ratings.comment: I studied with Uli (Dr. Schamiloglu) for 2 years.  He is an super person who had an amazing relationship with his students.  He got me full funding for 2 years and keeps up with me 20 years later!
No specifics- fun and easy class

His LCA 266 class was a breeze. A take home midterm, which took forever, and a slightly shorter final (also take-home). You don't have to read the books because you can use them on the quizzes in discussion. Check them out from the library if his TA doesn't let you. Attendance is very optional. I just chilled and listened to music during lectures.
This guy is awful, his lectures are useless, the TA doesn't help and the take home tests are impossibly specific.

Lectures are useless and not mandatory. The TA sucks; the most of the discussion sessions are film-showing and he tracks attendance! Take-home exams are time consuming and not helpful at all. He just wants to check key terms in the reading. Do the Doc conversion as the guy said under. Do NOT take it if you are not very into this topic.

This rating is to help people out on the LCA 100 midterm and final. In order to save yourself literally days of work time, do the following. Turn all of the PDF readings into word docs so you can search for key terms and phrases. Google how to do this. Remember to rotate the PDFs before you convert them. Also, search using Google Books for the text
Completely useless lectures. Take home exam, but be ready to answer the hardest, most trivial questions ever. Exams are EXTREMELY time consuming. Don't take his class.

Ok..so, this professor is one of the hilarious one. He is very knowledgeable but the problem is he cannot deliver the knowledge. You can easily pull off an A if you have a good study group and make sure you attend at least few lectures so you are not lost while doing the exam.

Take this class if you want an easy A.  Do NOT take this class if you want to learn anything.  This guy's lectures are unprepared and pointless, don't bother going.  Take home exam is not that hard if you realize the books are on googlebooks, so you can quickly search for the exact phrases he's looking for.

Take home exams are completely unfair. Questions are the most detailed questions imaginable.  Put aside about a week and a half to do the take home exam.  I couldn't find some answers after reading through the books twice.  The questions were purely trivial, uninteresting, and frankly stupid.

Lectures were useless. He comes completely unprepared, and just rambles boringly for 50 minutes. I didnt go for about two months.  Tests are take home but very time consuming because they are so detailed. The books he assigns are actually very intersting and informative if you actually want to know about the topic

He gives take home exams, but asks the most specific questions imaginable.  He can be pretty funny at his own expense sometimes, but most of the time he is just reading straight from the books we were assigned to read.
Best professor on a campus full of great ones.
He is gone very, very often. When he lectures, he speaks way too fast, digresses, is hard to follow. The course is an extreme disappointment!!!

Lectures are boring, readings are dry, the take home exams are the most annoying exams I've ever taken in my entire life. (Asks for specific details that are the most random and useless bits of information and you must site specific page numbers) History is my favorite subject, but this class almost destroyed my love of the subject.

His teaching style is one of the unique ones I have ever encountered in my college. The class itself is easy so far, but lecture is reallly really boring. He says "U know" at least 2o times in a minute and there is nothing to take notes on! He is a good guy, I don't know if it helps to attend his lecture.
STUPIDEST CLASS EVER! Don't take this if you don't have to. He just reads random passages from the books in lecture and the exams ask the most pointless questions
Went to lecture 4 times.  Very very Easy B.  Depending on your TA and how he grades papers, potentially very easy A.  Intermediate humanity credit?--wow!

Easiest class you will ever take. I am being completely literal when I say you do not have to go to any of the lectures. Two papers, two exams (both take home). All of them can be done by selectively reading the texts. I stopped going 2 weeks in and didn't read any of the texts entirely by any stretch of the imagination. Grade: AB
lectures are worthless. dont go. but other then that....take home exams!!! nuff said

One of the easiest professors in UW.  When he says that its due next week...its more like at the end of the semester.  Pretty disorganized but one hell of a teacher and an easy grader.  Everyone gets a B or higher.

One of the best professors ever. A bit disorganized, but his class is so interesting you won't mind. Also, his take-home exams rock. He is very understanding if you need a few days extension. Provides lots of video/audio materials. He also runs an International Learning Community ILS 98. Take it if you live in Adams ILC and have that time open.
best teacher ever, funny, nice, really helpful. i love taking classes with him. easy but you do have to do work, his midterms and finals take time along with the papers.

This class was the easiest I have ever taken. Attending lectures was pretty much pointless as he basically spent the whole time summarizing the readings.  Take home exams.  A really nice and intelligent guy though.

very easy class, but lectures are absolutely useless. he just put up the book on the overhead and read from it.  he is a nice smart guy though and if you goto office hours he can help you out alot, but the material is easy enough that you can skip class the entire semester and still get an A

So, I went to class at the beginning then I skipped the rest of the semester. Still got an astounding A!... Easy as cake. I love this guy, he is way helpful too. Get to know him, he is really nice and interested in what he teaches!! Great guy!

I thought this class would be painfully boring when I registered for it (it was the only lit class available at the time), but I ended up really enjoying it.  Uli is a great guy, get to know him if you can.

Uli's a very nice guy, but he doesn't seem to do any preparation for his lectures; he just rambles on.  It makes them *really* boring to sit through.  You can learn some good things from his class: he tends to choose good readings, and his take-home exams highlight the important things you should get from the readings. Still boring, though.

Lectures are ridiculously boring. I wanted to die. Fortunately, its not necessary to always attend. The papers are graded easily, as well as the map assignments. The tests, while take-home, took years to complete.  I liked the day we watched the 60 minutes episode on Turkmenistan.

Uli's a really nice guy and likes to be helpful, but I found his lectures very hard to follow, even if I had read the reading material.  Going to lecture is seriously unnecessary.  Everything graded is based on the readings.  It IS true that this class is extremely easy to get an A in.  I pretty much hated this class, just because it was so boring.

Thank god I don't know the person who rated ULI right before me, because if i did, I'd have to stab them in the eye.  This class is by far the easiest class you will ever have the chance to take in college, and anyone who says otherwise is just stupid, period.  I just finished the class, did about 10 hours of real work, and have a 99 percent avg.

This was by far the most boring class i have ever taken.  Uli is the most boring lecturer, the only thing that was discussed in class were the readings outside of class. The tests were take homes but were RIDICULOUS and took hours if not days to complete! ULI SUCKS!
Central Asian History was a really interesting class. Extremely informative, plus he's hilarious. ULI ROCKS!!!!!!!
